Class Validator<T>

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.gmail.ivanjermakov1.jtrue.core.Validator<T>
  • Type Parameters:
    T - validated object type
    All Implemented Interfaces:
    Validatable<T> 

    public class Validator<T>
extends java.lang.Object
implements Validatable<T>
    Main implementation of Validatable. Used to validate java object instances.

    • Method Detail

      • check

        public Validator<T> check(java.util.function.Predicate<T> predicate)
        Add new rule to this validator. Target object is valid if all rule's predicates are true for that object.

        This is intermediate operation.
        Parameters:
        predicate - validation rule
        Returns:
        validator, configured for that rule

      • check

        public Validator<T> check(java.util.function.Predicate<T> predicate,
                          java.lang.String message)
        Add new rule to this validator. Target object is valid if all rule's predicates are true for that object.

        This is intermediate operation.
        Parameters:
        predicate - validation rule
        message - error message for failing this rule. Can be used with terminal operation #listErrors(T)
        Returns:
        validator, configured for that rule

      • map

        public <F> Validator.FieldValidator<F,T> map(java.util.function.Function<T,F> mapFunction)
        Map to validate certain field of a target object.

        This is intermediate operation.
        Type Parameters:
        F - field type
        Parameters:
        mapFunction - mapping function
        Returns:
        specific Validator.FieldValidator to validate field next

      • throwing

        public Validator<T> throwing(java.util.function.Supplier<java.lang.Throwable> throwableSupplier)
        Configure custom exception for failing validation.

        Can be used with terminal operation #throwInvalid(T) This is intermediate operation.
        Parameters:
        throwableSupplier - supplier of exception to be thrown
        Returns:
        validator, configured for that exception

      • validate

        public boolean validate(T target)
        Checks whether target object is valid or not. Object is valid if none of the RuleResult result is false.

        This is a terminal operation.
        Specified by:
        validate in interface Validatable<T>
        Parameters:
        target - target object
        Returns:
        true if object is valid, false otherwise

      • throwInvalid

        public void throwInvalid(T target)
                  throws java.lang.Throwable
        Throws Throwable when target is invalid.

        This is a terminal operation.
        Specified by:
        throwInvalid in interface Validatable<T>
        Parameters:
        target - verification target object
        Throws:
        java.lang.Throwable - when target is invalid

      • listErrors

        public java.util.List<java.lang.String> listErrors(T target)
        List errors from all failed rule checks.

        Error message can be specified calling check(Predicate, String). Default message is . This is a terminal operation.
        Parameters:
        target - verification target object
        Returns:
        list of error messages
